content: The following lists events that happened during **(/wiki/1955) in [Colony of Singapore](/wiki/Colony_of_Singapore)**. ## Incumbents - [Governor](/wiki/List_of_Governors_of_Singapore): - until 2 June: Sir [John Fearns Nicoll](/wiki/John_Fearns_Nicoll) - 2 June-30 June: Sir [William Goode](/wiki/William_Allmond_Codrington_Goode) (as Officer Administrating the Government) - starting 30 June: Sir [Robert Brown Black](/wiki/Robert_Brown_Black) - [Chief Minister](/wiki/Chief_Minister_of_Singapore): [David Marshall](/wiki/David_Marshall_(Singaporean_politician)) - [Colonial Secretary](/wiki/List_of_Chief_Secretaries_of_Singapore): Sir [William Goode](/wiki/William_Allmond_Codrington_Goode) (till January 1955) - [Chief Secretary](/wiki/List_of_Chief_Secretaries_of_Singapore): Sir [William Goode](/wiki/William_Allmond_Codrington_Goode) (starting February 1955) ## Events ### January - 1 January – The Singapore Telephone Board (STB) and Telephone Department (TD) are formed after the British Colonial Government terminated Oriental Telephone and Electric Company's licence, thus acquiring its assets. The STB takes control of domestic telephone lines, with the TD controlling trunk and international services. ### April - 2 April – Singapore held its first [Legislative Assembly](/wiki/Legislative_Assembly_of_Singapore) [elections](/wiki/1955_Singaporean_general_election). The [Singapore Labour Front](/wiki/Labour_Front) (LF) won the [elections](/wiki/1955_Singaporean_general_election), the first where a majority of seats were contested. - 6 April – [David Marshall](/wiki/David_Marshall_(Singaporean_politician)) became the first [Chief Minister](/wiki/Chief_Minister_of_Singapore) of Singapore. - 7 April – The [Ministry of Education](/wiki/Ministry_of_Education_(Singapore)) is established. - 23 April – The [Hock Lee bus workers' strike](/wiki/Hock_Lee_bus_riots) began. - 30 April – Singapore Harbour Board Staff Association Strike. ### May - 12 May – The Hock Lee strikes escalated into a [riot](/wiki/Hock_Lee_bus_riots), resulting in 4 fatalities. ### June - 2 June – Sir [John Nicoll](/wiki/John_Nicoll_(colonial_administrator)) retires and [William Goode](/wiki/William_Goode_(colonial_administrator)) becomes acting Governor of Singapore. - 30 June – Sir [Robert Black](/wiki/Robin_Black_(colonial_administrator)) becomes the 3rd [Governor of Singapore](/wiki/Governor_of_Singapore). ### July - 1 July – The [Central Provident Fund](/wiki/Central_Provident_Fund) is formed as a savings scheme to support workers during retirement. - 6 July – The Singapore Harbour Board Staff Association Strike ends. ### August - 20 August – The [Paya Lebar Airport](/wiki/Paya_Lebar_Air_Base#History) is officially opened, replacing the [Kallang Airport](/wiki/Kallang_Airport) which opened on 12 June 1937. ### September - 8 September – The [Van Kleef Aquarium](/wiki/Van_Kleef_Aquarium) is opened. - 22 September – To deal with crimes, the [Criminal Law (Temporary Provisions) Act](/wiki/Criminal_Law_(Temporary_Provisions)_Act_(Singapore)) is passed, allowing for detentions. ### October - 7 October – The [Singapore Chinese Middle School Students Union](/wiki/Chinese_middle_school_student_riots) is formed. ### November - 23 November – The administration of [Cocos (Keeling) Islands](/wiki/Cocos_(Keeling)_Islands) is transferred to [Australia](/wiki/Australia) after several delays. ### December - 10 December – The [Asia Insurance Building](/wiki/Asia_Insurance_Building) is opened, then Southeast Asia's tallest building. - 28-29 December – [David Marshall](/wiki/David_Marshall_(Singaporean_politician)) represented the government of the [Crown Colony of Singapore](/wiki/Colony_of_Singapore) in the [Baling Talks](/wiki/Baling_Talks). ## Births - 7 January – [Lee Wei Ling](/wiki/Lee_Wei_Ling), neurologist (d. 2024). - 24 January – [Ang Yong Guan](/wiki/Ang_Yong_Guan), politician and psychiatrist. - 30 January – [Zhu Houren](/wiki/Zhu_Houren), actor and filmmaker. - 11 July – [Balaji Sadasivan](/wiki/Balaji_Sadasivan), former [Senior Minister of State for Foreign Affairs](/wiki/Ministry_of_Foreign_Affairs) (d. 2010). - 10 August – [Bey Soo Khiang](/wiki/Bey_Soo_Khiang), business executive and former [RSAF](/wiki/Republic_of_Singapore_Air_Force) lieutenant general. - 3 October – [Yaacob Ibrahim](/wiki/Yaacob_Ibrahim), former politician. - 27 October – [Michael Chiang](/wiki/Michael_Chiang), playwright. - 9 December – [Rahimah Rahim](/wiki/Rahimah_Rahim_(singer,_born_1955)), singer. ### Dates unknown - [Sim Wong Hoo](/wiki/Sim_Wong_Hoo), founder of [Creative Technology](/wiki/Creative_Technology) (d. 2023). ## Deaths - 12 April – Teo Kim Eng, Hokkien businessman (b. 1893). - 9 October – Tham Soong, concubine of Cheong Chin Nam (b. 1880). -
